intro: Meibomia huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough or hairy texture. Meibomia huillensis is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests at higher elevations.
